meanings.definition: Make (a bill or other proposal) law.
meanings.sent1: The government will enact the new law next week.
meanings.sent2: The president will enact the policy to improve healthcare.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to enact a silly rule for their classroom.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's words seemed to enact a magical spell over the students.
meanings.sent5: The judge's gavel striking down enacted justice in the courtroom.

meanings.sent1: The actors will enact the final scene of the play tonight.
meanings.sent2: She will enact the role of the brave princess in the school play.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to enact a funny skit for their parents.
meanings.sent4: His emotions seemed to enact a storm on the stage.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's movements enacted a beautiful story without words.
